column6: Clinging to the past is hampering your independence. You are unable to adjust to the loss. You may need to seek professional help, e.g., a Psychologist.
You can talk about the loss with some comfort. You show confidence in some of your daily tasks.
You are not comfortable adapting to changes around you. Other issues not shown in this exercise may also be troubling you.
You are feeling overwhelmed and unable to deal with issues worrying you.
You are able to stay calm in situations. You have a good understanding of your capabilities.
You have put a pause on things that frustrate you. There may be other issues holding you back.
You show very little mixed feelings. You are able to deal with issues of importance.
You blame yourself for the situation you are in. You can tackle other challenges with a great deal of positivity.
Conflicting feelings are holding you back. You have the ability to overcome some negative emotions.
You have come to realise your experiences with this loss will make you stronger. You have a good understanding of your capabilities.
Anger and pain have died down, and youâ€™re left in a more calm and relaxed state. You show confidence in handling your daily activities.
You begin to put pieces of your life back together and move forward positively. You show confidence in some of your daily tasks.
